title: Seamanship Fundamentals & Boat Handling
description: Comprehensive test on anchorwork, rigging, knots, boat parts, and seamanship procedures

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of an anchor on a ship?

options.b: To hold ship temporarily to sea bed in shallow water

questions.explanation: An anchor is a hook attached to cable that holds a ship temporarily to the sea bed in comparatively shallow water.

questions.text: Which part of the anchor helps it dig into the sea bed?
questions.explanation: Flukes are the parts that dig into the sea bed when the anchor is dragged, providing holding power.

questions.text: What are the three main types of ropes used onboard ships?

options.a: Natural fibre, Manmade, and Steel wire ropes

questions.explanation: The three main types are Natural fibre ropes, Manmade ropes, and Steel wire ropes.

questions.text: Which knot is most useful for making temporary eyes in ropes of all sizes?
questions.explanation: Bow line is the most useful knot for making temporary eyes and can be used as a lifeline round a man's waist.

questions.text: What is the order 'Give way together' used for in boat pulling?

options.b: To start pulling together by whole crew

questions.explanation: 'Give way together' is the order to start pulling and is obeyed together by the whole crew.

questions.text: Which part of the boat is the 'Gunwale'?

options.b: The upper edge of the boat's side

questions.explanation: Gunwale is the upper edge of the boat's side, an important structural part.

questions.text: What does the order 'Hold water' mean in boat pulling?

options.b: Reduce or stop boat's way by holding oars at right angles

questions.explanation: 'Hold water' is the order to reduce or stop the way of the boat by holding oars at right angles with blades in water.

questions.text: Which type of shackle is used for joining lengths of chain together?
questions.explanation: Joining shackles are used for coupling links or joining ropes, webbing, chain together.

questions.text: What is a 'Derrick' used for on ships?

options.c: Hoisting boats, stores, cargo, or gear

questions.explanation: A derrick is a spar rigged as a swinging boom used for hoisting boats, stores, cargo, ammunition or gear.

questions.text: Which part of the oar has copper bands and leather?
questions.explanation: The loom of the oar has copper bands and leather for protection and grip.

questions.text: What is the process of joining rope ends by interlocking strands called?
questions.explanation: Splicing is a method of joining ends of two ropes or making an eye by interlocking strands.

questions.text: Which natural fibre rope is known for its water resistance and durability?
questions.explanation: Manila rope is known for its good water resistance and durability among natural fibre ropes.

questions.text: What does the order 'Eyes in the boat' mean?

options.b: Keep gaze from wandering and pay attention to duties

questions.explanation: 'Eyes in the boat' orders crew to keep their gaze from wandering and pay attention to their duties.

questions.text: Which hitch is useful for tying a line to a post when the end is not available?
questions.explanation: Clove hitch is useful for tying a line to a post, even when the end of the line is not available.

questions.text: What is the 'Stem' of a boat?
questions.explanation: Stem is the frontmost part of the boat's structure.

questions.text: Which type of anchor has tripping palms that help flukes dig into the bottom?
questions.explanation: Admirality pattern anchor has tripping palms that tilt the flukes to dig into the sea bed.

questions.text: What is the purpose of 'Bottle Screw Slip' in cable work?
questions.explanation: Bottle Screw Slip is used for securing cable to buoy in anchorwork.

questions.text: Which knot is used to secure a rope's end to a spar or bale?
questions.explanation: Timber hitch is used to secure a rope's end to a spar or bale.

questions.text: What does the order 'Back together' accomplish in boat pulling?

options.b: Move boat backward by pushing on oar looms

questions.explanation: 'Back together' orders crew to back water together by pushing on looms instead of pulling.

questions.text: Which part of the cable is painted white for identification?

options.c: Every joining shackle except one between half shackles

questions.explanation: Every joining shackle except one between two half shackles is painted white for cable identification.

questions.text: What is the 'Keel' of a boat?
questions.explanation: Keel is the bottom centerline structure that provides stability and strength.

questions.text: Which type of splice reduces rope strength the least?
questions.explanation: Long splice maintains most of the rope's original strength compared to other splices.

questions.text: What is the role of the Coxswain in a pulling boat?

options.b: To synchronize pulling and steer the boat

questions.explanation: Coxswain is responsible for ensuring crew pulls steadily and together, and for steering correctly.

questions.text: Which equipment is essential in a pulling boat for safety?
questions.explanation: Life jacket for all crew is essential safety equipment in a pulling boat.

questions.text: What is the 'Painter' on a boat?

options.a: The person who paints the boat
options.b: A rope at bow for securing boat

questions.explanation: Painter is a rope at the bow used for securing the boat to ship or shore.
